meanings.definition: Demonstrate the truth or existence of something by evidence or argument.
meanings.sent1: She tried to proove her theory with facts.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used experiments to proove his hypothesis.
meanings.sent3: He wanted to proove he was right, so he gathered all the evidence.
meanings.sent4: The lawyer prooved his case beyond any doubt.
meanings.sent5: The detective needed to proove the suspect's guilt.

meanings.definition: Show oneself to be worthy or capable.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to proove her skills in the competition.
meanings.sent2: He had to proove himself in his new job.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to proove he could handle the challenge.
meanings.sent4: The athlete prooved his talent on the field.
meanings.sent5: The singer needed to proove her abilities to the audience.
